channel.title: C++
channel.description:
Anybody know it or interested in the language? Currently learning it.
Also be nice if someone can toss me some resources.

item.title: C++
item.dc:creator: @baddy351 baddy351
item.description:
@baddy351 wrote:

I wouldn’t say it is impossible. I would state that there is no way to master that, or java, or other languages. They just have to much in them. You cannot master most programming languages (even VB and shit, is very hard and takes years to fully understand). And why console based? There is so much more you can do with c++. I myself am making a shooter game (third-person AND first-person) with c++. GUI is easy with c++, for it is microsoft based who are “Lovers of GUI”. I rest my case.

Read full topic

item.title: C++
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

I think “C++ is hard to master” actually understates the issue. I’d say its IMPOSSIBLE.

Read full topic

item.title: C++
item.dc:creator: @ripzone Triton
item.description:
@ripzone wrote:

And what does that say about C++ being easy/hard to master? Nothing.

I’ve been programming C++ also for 3/4 years and consider myself an average C++ programmer, there’s loads of techniques I’ve yet to master, like template meta-programming, variadiac templates, r-value references, understanding the C++ memory model, and all the new C++0x new features like lambdas, initializer lists, etc.

Also all the C++ idioms, and there are loads of them to learn.

But I rest my case. If you are that good and know everything there is to know about C++, then congratulations.

Most of us haven’t yet achieved that. Heck, even Walter Bright, who is the only one in the world to have built a fully working C++ compiler by himself, considers his skill of C++ to be 5 in 1 to 10.

Read full topic

item.title: C++
item.dc:creator: @SETO SETO
item.description:
@SETO wrote:

[quote=“Triton, post:5, topic:413746”][quote author=SETO link=topic=515706.msg3745090#msg3745090 date=1315679583]

I know some C++, it is a tough language to master.

If you are a complete beginner, then I suggest the C++ Primer (Plus) book. Do not rely on web tutorials because most of them are wrong or teach bad practices.

C++ is not hard to master, and if you want online resource try cplusplus.com
[/quote]

Oh… You lost a good chance to not embarrass yourself :)[/quote]
??, i don’t know why you are saying C++ is tough to master, unless you just started C++.
i been coding in C++ for over 4 years and get paid to do it. Mostly data analyzer’s for nano particles.

Read full topic
